I used to think that I would personally never have an abortion. Ieven considered myself to be pro-life at one point. Circumstances in my life have caused me to completely re-evaluate how I feel about all of this.
 
 I live with mental illness and a personality disorder. I also have narcolepsy. The worse the narcolepsy gets, the harder a time I have with mental problems, and vice versa. Right now I am able to hold a precarious balance with 10-11 hours of sleep nightly, strong medications, and the support of my loved ones. I am a single parent to a six year old and I work full-time, with great difficulty, to care for her. After the birth of my daughter I had post-partum psychosis for about a year. Prior to that and since then I've had other psychotic periods brought on by high levels of stress, lack of adaquate sleep, and other health problems. Just a couple of weeks ago I had a psychotic episode lasting a few days caused by a new narcolepsy drug I was trying. I called my SO, utterly terrified, and asked him for help. When he arrived at my home I was shoving a dirty sewing pin into my forearm over and over again. I just wanted my life to end in the worst way, but I couldn't bear doing that to my little girl. The infection has healed now, and the bruises have faded. You can still see all the little marks where the pin punctured my skin, but the anxiety is going to stay with me much longer, I'm afraid.
 
 Have you ever been through this? Losing control over your mind? It's the most overwhelming feeling of terror I can imagine. Two days was bad enough. I couldn't even consider going through that again for another year. There is no way in hell I will put myself *or* my child through that again willingly. She needs a mom who can take care of her. That's far more important than any potential child.
 
 Based on most pro-life beliefs my options are to either be celibate for the next 25 years minimum, or take the risk of putting myself and my child through misery (since any contraceptive method includiing sterilization carried some risk of failure). I don't find either one of those options acceptable. I really hope none of you ever find yourself facing that kind of choice.
